intro: Rosa arvensis f. biserrata, commonly known as the roughleaf dog玫瑰, is a variant of the common dog rose. It is characterized by its serrated, rough-textured leaves and fragrant pink to white flowers. This plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia and thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. It is a shrub that can grow up to 1.5 meters tall, with thorny stems and compound leaves. The flowers appear in summer and are often used in hedgerows and gardens for their ornamental value.
